name: Kalsubai Peak
description: Kalsubai is the highest peak in Maharashtra, renowned for its sweeping Sahyadri views, the famous summit temple of Kalsubai Devi, and the thrilling trek route, which includes four steep iron ladders and rocky ascents. It’s a classic monsoon and winter trek, accessible for beginners and regular trekkers alike.

startingPoint.name: Bari Village (primary base)
startingPoint.description: Bari is the key base village, with approach roads from Igatpuri (Nashik-Kasara highway side) and Bhandardara (via Ghoti). Rickshaws and buses ply to base, ample parking available.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: 108 (ambulance), 112 (any emergency); inform Bari locals before trek

restaurants: Local home kitchens (veg Maharashtrian thali, poha, tea)
shops: General stores with packaged water, snacks, and cereals
waterSources: Wells and pumps in village (filter/boil before drinking)
No perennial sources—carry minimum 2L per person
Some seasonal stalls on ladders route selling bottled water
foodOptions: Villager-run snack stalls on busy weekends (monsoon/winter)

facilities: Temple platform and limited shaded area
Occasional stalls (peak season, holidays) at summit
recommendations: Carry all supplies to the top

locations: Plateau near summit (below main temple, windy)
Farm fields, homestay lawns at Bari
facilities: Tent rental (advance booking); limited at summit; basic
Most camping organized at fields below the final ascent
camping.cost: ₹800–1,200 per person (tent + local food; pre-book with contacts below)

permits.entry: Free; nominal village maintenance donation (₹20–₹50 advisable)
permits.timings: Open: sunrise to sunset (night treks common in season; best to inform Bari Sarpanch prior to overnight plans)

precautions: Wear good trekking shoes with grip
Climb ladders one-by-one; avoid crowd rush
Carry rain gear and headlamp for night trek
Travel in groups for night/midnight treks

nearestHospital.name: Primary Health Care Center, Bari (basic), Ghoti Rural Hospital (full)

monsoon.conditions: Heavy rain, waterfall-laced slopes, slippery ladder and rocks, thick mist
monsoon.recommendation: Scenic but challenging; pack rainwear, avoid weekends for crowd safety

winter.conditions: Cool, clear skies, perfect for sunrise trek/camping
winter.recommendation: Best season for all trekkers, day and night

summer.conditions: Hot, strong sun on ascent, dry and dusty till plateau
summer.recommendation: Early start for sunrise or evening descent advised

trekRoute.difficulty: Moderate for fit trekkers; ladders and rocky patches require care

waypoints.name: Farm Fields & Stream
waypoints.description: Initial walk through village farms, water crossing

waypoints.name: First Plateau/Mango tree rest point
waypoints.description: Flat section post farm trail; last tree shade before climb

waypoints.name: First Ladder Section
waypoints.description: Series of iron ladders up steep rock; water/snack stall nearby in season

waypoints.name: Large Plateau/Night Camping Zone
waypoints.description: Common night halt, summit in sight

waypoints.name: Summit (Kalsubai Temple)
waypoints.description: Final ladders to temple, panoramic view

byTrain.description: Mumbai CST/Dadar to Kasara (Central line), then jeep/auto to Bari (50 km road)
steps: Jeep/shared taxi to Bari via Ghoti

byBus.description: ST bus from Mumbai to Igatpuri/Ghoti, then jeep to Bari

byPrivateVehicle.description: Drive via NH160, exit at Ghoti, continue to Bari
steps: Turn towards Bhandardara, follow Bari signage

byTrain.description: Train to Igatpuri/Kasara, then local jeep/auto

byBus.description: Pune–Sangamner ST bus, then Sangamner to Bari by local vehicles

steps: Via Rajur and Bhandardara to Bari village

bestTimeToVisit: October–February (clear, cool, safe); Monsoon (for waterfalls, experienced trekkers only)

localContacts.name: Dadanche Hotel & Trekking/Guide (Mr. Ravindra Khade)
localContacts.service: Local guide, tent booking, meals, group/camping
